sub_title: Assistant Professor, TU Delft | Electric vehicles & charging, Batteries, Power electronics, V2G
summary:
Electric vehicles - EV charging - Power electronics - PV systems - Energy Storage - Demand Side Management - Wireless power transfer

I’m a Tenured Assistant professor in the DC systems, Energy conversion and Storage group in the Department of Electrical Sustainable Energy at the Delft University of Technology, The Netherlands. I am currently involved in several European research projects on electric vehicles, smart charging of EVs, power electronics and demand side management. I am the coordinator and a lecturer for Massive Open Online Course (MOOC) on Electric cars on edX.org with ~200,000 learners from 175 countries. 

During my PhD, I developed a solar powered V2G electric vehicle charger that is compatible with CHAdeMO and CCS/COMBO DC charging standard designed smart charging algorithms. The project was in collaboration with PRE Power Developers, ABB and UT Austin and showcased in the TU Delft research exhibition ‘dig-it’ 2017 and was awarded the ‘Most significant innovation in electric vehicles’ at the IDTechEx Show 2018 in Berlin. You can follow my academic work via Google scholar. 

I’m am passionate about electric vehicles and collaborate on projects related to DC micro-grids, energy management systems for smart grids, PV systems, battery storage and contactless power transfer. I have an MSc from the Delft University of Technology and B.Tech from National Institute of Technology Trichy in Electrical Engineering. I have worked for GE Global Research, Munich during my masters on power electronic based voltage controllers for distribution networks. I have collaborated with several industrial and public institutions namely DNV GL, Alfen, SolarNRG, AIT, driivz, Alliander, E-laad, Stedin, PRE and ABB. 

I’m constantly looking for collaborators and interested in hearing from former colleagues, managers, or just interesting folks working on electric mobility, PV and power electronics. So feel free to contact through Linkedin or via G.R.Chandramouli@tudelft.nl.

treasury_media.title: TU Delft : Solar-powered bidirectional EV charging station
Solar powered e-bike charging station @ TU Delft
treasury_media.description: Part of the team that developed a solar powered e-bike charging station @ TU Delft. The station has both grid connected and off-grid operation and provides three types of e-bike charging : AC, DC and contactless charging.

treasury_media.title: dig-it exhibition : Solar-powered V2G EV charger
treasury_media.description: V2G solar charger showcased as part of 2017 dig-it exhibition, the largest science exhibition of the Netherlands

treasury_media.title: eMove360° Award: Outstanding Nominees Prove New Award and Trade Fair Concept
treasury_media.description:
Nominated in the Category Energy Storage:
Chakratec – Smart Kinetic Energy Storage
Delta Energy Systems – EV Power Bank
PRE power developers & TU Delft – Bidirectional EV Charger / Solar Inverter

treasury_media.title: Fast and direct vehicle charging with solar energy
treasury_media.description: At the TU Delft Research Exhibition on Tuesday 6 and Wednesday 7 June, the DCE&S group, TU Delft and PRE demonstrated a system for charging electric vehicles directly with power from solar panels.

treasury_media.title: The breakthrough: New fast charger that is solar powered
treasury_media.description: On the Dutch national television NPO1 in their prime time series ‘Breakthrough’ (Doorbraak). Talking about the solar powered electric vehicle charger that we developed during my PhD at TU Delft and PRE. The show is in Dutch with my part in English.

projects.title: Winner of NRG Battle Europe Edition 2013
projects.description: Winning team of the second round and the finals. Promoted the use of Silicon as an energy carrier to provide base load power. Racing Aeolus is a wind energy powered car race that has been taking place since 2005. 
Part of the electrical team working on the design of the generator and power electronic drive of the car.

Product Strategy Manager at Porsche AG

projects.title: A simple maximum power point tracking (MPPT) scheme for a wind energy system
projects.description:
• Modeled & simulated the connection of a SEIG to grid via rectifier-inverter power electronic interface. 
• Developed a unique relation between the per-unit rotor speed and the inverter firing angle corresponding to maximum power extraction as a lookup table & implemented it in a microcontroller.
• Verified the simulated results employing a hardware setup.

projects.title: Improving the performance of thin-film silicon solar cell technology
projects.description: Overview of current technologies used in the manufacture of thin-film silicon solar cell and analysis of their bottlenecks. Reviewed various strategies currently being researched globally to improve the efficiency of thin-film silicon cells.

profile_positions.description:
- DC systems, Energy conversion and Storage group -> Department of Electrical Sustainable Energy -> Delft University of Technology, The Netherlands
- Focussed on electric mobility & charging infrastructure 
- List of Publications - http://bit.ly/scholar-grcm
- Smart Trolley grid - Developing solutions to make trolley grids and busses, smarter, sustainable and less polluting 
- Orchestrating Smart Charging in Mass Deployment - Developing charging algorithms and solutions to make mass charging of EVs cheaper and more sustainable
- Flexgrid - Developing power electronics and smart control for extracting maximum flexibility from future Dutch homes that have EV, PV, storage, heat pumps and flexible loads. 
- Flexible Energy Communities - Developing and modelling the EV and charging systems for enabling flexible energy communities and quantifying the EV flexibility for smart charging and V2G
- FLOW-  H2020 2ZERO call. Development of smart charging algorithms for V1G and V2G including grid congestion evaluation and multi-criteria assessment model including emissions, grid impact, user convenience and charging cost
- TULIPS - H2020 Green airports : Solar powered, modular, intelligent, direct DC charging infrastructure for aircraft and airside and landside airport vehicles
- FLEXInet - RVO MOOI, Intelligent flexibility through integrated power electronics hardware and smart energy management of solar, electric vehicles, electric and thermal storage , and heat pump.   
- NEON: New (transport) Energy Outlook in the Netherlands - Investigate the impact of electric mobility, charging infrastructure, energy storage and renewable energy on the Dutch electricity and energy infrastructure.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor (Tenured)

profile_positions.description:
- Developed a four-part massive open online course on edx.org on Electric cars: Introduction, Technology, Business and Policy. 
- Lecturer for the Electric cars: Technology course teaching concepts on EV charging 
- With over 80,000 registrations from 175 countries
profile_positions.title: Course coordinator & Lecturer: Massive Open Online Course (MOOC): Electric Cars
Associate Editor, IEEE Transactions on Transportation Electrification

profile_positions.description:
- Smart Trolley grid project of Electric Mobility Europe with 5 international partners. Developing solutions to make trolley grids and busses, smarter, sustainable and less polluting 
- Orchestrating Smart Charging in mass Deployment project of Electric Mobility Europe with 4 international partners. Developing charging algorithms and solutions to make mass charging of EVs cheaper and more sustainable
- Flexgrid project of TKI Urban Energy.  Developing power electronics and smart control for extracting maximum flexibility from future Dutch homes that have EV, PV, storage, heat pumps and flexible loads.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
- Developed a solar powered, bidirectional electric vehicle charger providing Chademo and COMBO DC charging and vehicle-to-grid (V2G). The project was in collaboration with PRE Power developers, ABB , Last Mile solutions and University of Texas at Austin. 
- Power converter, Silicon carbide devices, closed loop control, hardware prototyping and testing
- System design, energy management system, smart charging algorithms, C#, OML
- The PhD project was supervised by Professor Pavol Bauer and Professor Miro Zeman from TU Delft in the DC systems, Energy conversion & Storage group. 
- Link to PhD thesis - http://tiny.cc/grcm-phd
profile_positions.title: PHD Researcher

profile_positions.description:

- Power electronic design, closed loop control, system design, PLECS, MATLAB

Miro Zeman working on "Development of glass etching using a chemical etch method on the TCO layer for application in solar cells" - for etching process research on Asahi U type glass substrate for light management in thin-film solar cells.

company.name: Institute for Electronic Design Automation, TU Munich

profile_positions.description: Summer Intern at TU Munich through the DAAD WISE (Working Internship in Science and Engineering) program. Aged timing behavior of a circuit was determined by developing an aging-aware gate model of sequential cells using static timing analysis approach.
profile_positions.title: DAAD Summer Research Fellow

profile_positions.description: Performed an analysis of AFTC, a technique in railway signalling for confirming the absence of a train in a track section and testing for failure on the side of safety. PSpice 9.1 was employed and it was shown that the system could fail in the presence of cross and structure bonds and under extreme cases of rail breakage, proving fatal to commuters.It was accepted for presentation at IEEE INDICON 2009, India.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant
